messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: apology
messages.msgSnippet: ... Dunno about antipodean. but it is a slang word...dunno about common in the US, but it is of Common origins(G) Sharon
messages.messageBody:
--- Carol & Mac <mjcmbrwn@...> wrote:
> Is 'dunny' a word in common use in the US? I assumed
> it was an
> antipodean slang word?
>
> Carol
> in New Zealand

Dunno about antipodean. but it is a slang word...dunno
about common in the US, but it is of Common origins(G)

Sharon

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: apology

Is 'dunny' a word in common use in the US? I assumed it was an
antipodean slang word?

Carol
in New Zealand

Sharon Rudd wrote:

> Hi Chris
> I'm sorry. I didn't mean my comment as a complaint. I
> thought the typo was a bit of amusing scatological
> humor.
>
> I apologibe.....oops....apologize
>
> Sharon who cames...oops....makes scads of typos all of
> the time
>
> --- chrisoco@... wrote:
> > --- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., Sharon Rudd
> > <bearspawprint@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > I think the Dunny's guide is out to..
> > > > or due to be out.
> > > > > Chris O'Connor
> > >
> > > Chris...is that a Freudian slip or on purpose?
> >
> > Horrible keyboarding skills, forgot to spell check
> > and half asleep...
> > It should have been Dummy's Guide. I'll try to be
> > more careful. Sorry.
> >
> > in peace,
> >
> > Chris O'Connor
> >
> >

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] apology
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, you do not need to apologize This is a stressful day I hope your family is holding up well. Candace
messages.messageBody:
Hi, you do not need to apologize

This is a stressful day

I hope your family is holding up well.

Candace

messages.subject: Re: Re: apology
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/7/00 11:50:02 AM Pacific Standard Time, irocket@pacifier.com writes:  I wasn t going to say anything,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/7/00 11:50:02 AM Pacific Standard Time,
irocket@... writes:

<< God bless us all anyway. >>

I wasn't going to say anything, because it seemed like maybe it was an issue
of mine,,,,why i reacted to this,,,,,,but,,,,geeezzzzz,,,,,it's a free
country right,,,and an open forum here.
I took that remark to mean: if i don't agree, i should be blessed anyways.
And indicating that someone might have 'missed it' just because they didn't
agree.
And i'm sorry if this offends anyone, but i believe i am blessed just
because. I am a loving person, and if i don't agree with certain beliefs, i
am not any 'less blessed'. I have only been on this list for a few weeks,
but have always felt it was a very inclusive space,,,,and i know it's not
intended as a space for religious views.
But,,,sorry,,,here i go,,,, i believe i was born in love, not in sin,,,and i
choose to see that in others,,,,,,,,and i have a real problem with the 'God
bless us all anyway'--

God bless us all

period

Jennifer

messages.subject: Re: Re: apology
messages.msgSnippet: I m sorry, I will not name names or point fingers.  It s as plain as a the sun to me, but if you can t pick it out, that s a good thing, keep your innocence.
messages.messageBody:
I'm sorry, I will not name names or point fingers. It's as plain as a the sun to me, but if you can't pick it out, that's a good thing, keep your innocence. This subject is a dead horse. I'm done.

```````````````````````````````````
Virtually yours,
Corinna
irocket@...

----- Original Message -----
From: Thad Martin
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Sent: Friday, January 07, 2000 7:23 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: apology


i was hoping since you were so bothered by the direction and tone of the dialogue that you could be a bit specific about what exaclyt was done to offend you. i for one am not here to step on peoples toes but can't really address such ambiguous claims. just trying to be a considerate 'neighbor'. if the best i can do is hear you than consider it done.
-susan
austin,tx

Corinna wrote:

Susan, I don't know if you missed anything or not. It's all archived at onelist if you want to go see.

messages.subject: Re: apology
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, good, I m glad that wasn t considered a flame war.  It s as mean and nasty as I ever get, so now you ve all seen the worst of me. Susan, I don t know if
messages.messageBody:
Okay, good, I'm glad that wasn't considered a flame war. It's as mean and nasty as I ever get, so now you've all seen the worst of me.

Susan, I don't know if you missed anything or not. It's all archived at onelist if you want to go see.

God bless us all anyway.

```````````````````````````````````
Virtually yours,
Corinna
irocket@...

----- Original Message -----
From: Thad Martin
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Sent: Thursday, January 06, 2000 11:56 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] apology/Influences


Corinna wrote:
I dislike flame wars and to tell the truth, have never been in one before now. It just seemed more wrong to say nothing than to say something in defense of my religion. It saddens me to see such scorn of a truly beautiful faith.
what flame war?
and
who/ what was said that was against your religion?
did i miss something?

-susan
austin,tx
